title: ComputerSystem.0.94.0
description: This schema defines a computer system and its respective properties.  A computer system represents a machine (physical or virtual) and the local resources such as memory, cpu and other devices that can be accessed from that machine.
specification: This resource shall be used to represent resources that represent a computing system in the Redfish specification.

SystemType.description: The type of computer system represented by this resource.

enumDescriptions.Virtual: A virtual machine instance running on this system
enumDescriptions.PhysicalyPartitioned: A hardware-based partition of a computer system
enumDescriptions.VirtuallyPartitioned: A virtual or software-based partition of a computer system

SystemType.specification: An enumeration that indicates the kind of system that this resource represents.

Chassis.description: An array of references to the chassis in which this system is contained
Chassis.specification: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type Chassis that represents the physical container associated with this resource.

ManagedBy.description: An array of references to the Managers responsible for this system
ManagedBy.specification: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type manager that represents the resource with management responsibility for this resource.

SimpleNetwork.description: A reference to the Ethernet interfaces associated with this system
SimpleNetwork.specification: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type Collection with a MemberType of EthernetNetworkInterface.

SimpleStorage.description: A reference to the storage devices associated with this system
SimpleStorage.specification: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type Collection with a MemberType of SimpleStorage.

LogService.description: A reference to the Log Service associated with this system
LogService.specification: The value of this property shall reference a resource of type Collection with a MemberType of LogService.

links.description: Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.

AssetTag.description: This is a user definable tag that can be used to track this computer system for inventory or other client purposes.
AssetTag.specification: The value of this property shall contain the value of the asset tag of the system.

Manufacturer.description: This is the manufacturer or OEM of this computer system
Manufacturer.specification: The value of this property shall contain a value that represents the manufacturer of the system.

Model.description: This is the model information that the manufacturer refers to this comptuer system as.
Model.specification: The value of this property shall contain the information about how the manufacturer references this system.

SKU.description: The manufacturers SKU for this system.
SKU.specification: The value of this property shall contain the Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) for the system.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number for this system.
SerialNumber.specification: The value of this property shall contain the serial number for the system.

PartNumber.description: The part number for this system according to the manufacturer.
PartNumber.specification: The value of this property shall contain the part number for the system.

UUID.description: The universal unique identifier for this system.
UUID.specification: The value of this property shall contain the universal unique identifier number for the system.

IPAddress.description: The IP address(es) associated with this system
IPAddress.specification: The value of this property shall contain an array of IP addresses in a format as defined in RFC5737 or RFC5952.

HostMACAddress.description: The network MAC address(es) associated with this system
HostMACAddress.specification: The value of this property shall contain an array of MAC addresses in MAC-48 identifier format.

HostName.description: The Host Name of this system
HostName.specification: The value of this property shall contain the host name without any domain information.

HostFQDN.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of this system
HostFQDN.specification: The value of this property shall contain the fully qualified domain name for the host

HostCorrelation.description: This object shall contain operating environment reference information to correlate the system information with the host operating environment information to assist clients with correlating the two access points.

IndicatorLED.description: The state of the indicator LED.

enumDescriptions.Unknown: The state of the Indicator LED cannot be determined.

IndicatorLED.specification: The value of this property shall contain the indicator light state for the indicator light associated with this system.

Power.description: This is the current power state of the system
Power.specification: The value of this property shall contain the power state of the system.

BootSourceOverrideTarget.description: The current boot source to be used at next boot instead of the normal boot device, if BootSourceOverrideEnabled is true.

enumDescriptions.None: Boot from the normal boot device
enumDescriptions.Pxe: Boot from the Pre-Boot EXecution (PXE) environment.
enumDescriptions.Floppy: Boot from the floppy disk drive
enumDescriptions.Usb: Boot from a USB device as specified by the system BIOS
enumDescriptions.BiosSetup: Boot to the BIOS Setup Utility
enumDescriptions.UefiTarget: Boot to the UEFI Device specified in the UefiTargetBootSourceOverride property

BootSourceOverrideTarget.specification: The value of this property shall contain the source to boot the system from, overriding the normal boot order.  The value of this property shall be one of the values in the BootSourceOverrideSupported of this resource.

enumDescriptions.None: This system does not support any Boot Source Override targets
enumDescriptions.Pxe: This system supports PXE as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.Floppy: This system supports a Floppy disk as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.Cd: This system supports a CD/DVD disc as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.Usb: This system supports a USB device as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.Hdd: This system supports a hard disk as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.BiosSetup: This system supports BIOS Setup as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.Utilities: This system supports the manufacturer's Utilities program(s) as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.Diags: This system supports the manufacturer's Diagnostics program as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.UefiShell: This system supports the UEFI Shell as a Boot Source Override target
enumDescriptions.UefiTarget: This system supports a UEFI Device, specified in the UefiTargetBootSourceOverride property, as a Boot Source Override target

BootSourceOverrideSupported.specification: The values of this array shall be properties that shall contain the sources from which this system can be booted, overriding the normal boot order. Pxe indicates to PXE boot from the primary NIC; Floppy, Cd, Usb, Hdd indicates to boot from their devices respectively.  BiosSetup indicates to boot into the native BIOS screen setup.  Utilities & Diags indicates to boot from the local utilities or diags partitions and UefiTarget indicates to boot from the UEFI device path found in UefiTargetBootSourceOverride.

enumDescriptions.Disabled: The system will boot as normal
enumDescriptions.Once: On its next boot cycle, the system will boot (one time) to the Boot Source Override Target.
enumDescriptions.Continuous: The system will boot to the target specified in the BootSourceOverrideTarget until this property is set to Disabled.

BootSourceOverrideEnabled.description: Describes the state of the Boot Source Override feature
BootSourceOverrideEnabled.specification: The value of this property shall be Once if this is a one time boot override and Continuous if this selection should remain active until cancelled.

UefiTargetBootSourceOverrideSupported.description: An arrary of the valid UEFI targets available to the Boot Source Override feature. These values can be used in conjunction with BootSourceOverrideTarget (set to UefiTarget) and UefiTargetBootSourceOverride to select a specifc UEFI device for booting.
UefiTargetBootSourceOverrideSupported.specification: The values of this array shall be properties that shall contain the UEFI boot target sources from which this system can be booted, overriding the normal boot order.  BootSourceOverrideEnabled = Continuous is not supported for Uefi Boot Source Override as this setting is defined in UEFI as a one time boot only.

UefiTargetBootSourceOverride.description: This property is the Uefi Device Path of the device to boot from when BootSourceOverrideSupported is UefiTarget.
UefiTargetBootSourceOverride.specification: The value of this property shall be the UEFI device path of the override boot target.  The value of this property is only valid if BootSourceOverride is equal to the value UefiTarget.

Boot.description: This object contains the boot information for the current resource.

\\.[A-Za-z0-9]+$.description: allow any property to begin with a '.' (for model development only as an annotation)

Bios.description: This object provides information about the System BIOS.

Count.description: The number of processors in the system.
Count.specification: This property shall contain the number of central processors in the system.

ProcessorFamily.description: The processor family for the processor in this system.
ProcessorFamily.specification: This property shall contain the processor family for the central processors in the system, per the description in Table 22 of the SMBIOS Specification DSP0134 2.8 or later.

Processors.description: This object describes the central processors of the system in general detail.

TotalSystemMemoryGB.description: This is the total amount of memory in the system measured in GB.
TotalSystemMemoryGB.specification: This property shall contain the amount of total system general purpose memory as measured in gigabytes.

Memory.description: This object describes the central memory of the system in general detail.

Action.description: This action is used to reset the system.
Action.specification: This defines the name of the custom action for which the following properties are supported on this resource.

PropertyName.description: This is the type of reset to be performed.
PropertyName.specification: This defines the property name for which the following allowable values apply.

enumDescriptions.ForceOff: Turn the system off immediately (non-graceful) shutdown
enumDescriptions.GracefulRestart: Perform a graceful system shutdown followed by a restart of the system
enumDescriptions.ForceRestart: Perform an immediate (non-graceful) shutdown, followd by a restart of the system
enumDescriptions.Nmi: Generate a Non-Maskable Interrupt to cause an immediate system halt
enumDescriptions.PushPowerButton: Simulate the pressing of the physical power button on this system

AllowableValues.description: This array defines the supported values for this property on this resource.
AllowableValues.specification: This arrays shall show the possible reset types for the system.  On shall indicate the system will be turned on.  ForceOff shall indicate the system will be forced to turn off.  GracefuleShutdown shall indicate that a shutdown request will be sent to the operating environment. ForceRestart shall indicate the system can be restarted but no attempt at a graceful shutdown occur will occur.  Nmi shall indicate that a non-maskable interrupt can be instantiated. GracefulRestart indicates that a request can be made to shutdown the OS and then a restart of the system will occur.  ForceOn indicates that the system will be forced to turn on. PressPowerButton indicates a momentary press is simulated on the power button

Capabilities.description: This array item defines the allowable values supported for this custom action on this resource.

anyOf.description: This array item defines an available custom action on this resource.
